Review.Contenu: I absolutely regret purchasing this product. Seems like solid construction but the screws included in the kit are nowhere near enough to mount a full rack. The spec sheet seems to specify both M6 and 12/24, which are completely different size screws. I ordered both and neither one actually fits the frame. Are the screws for this rack a non-standard size? Why would you make me figure out what screw fits? Terrible experience. I even purchased other navepoint products and even those screws don't fit on their own product!!!

Contacted customer service.  They told me they would send out the correct part, have not heard from them after 4 emails.  Long time customer.  Will not buy from them again.

Only to be called a few days later that I need to pay an extra $150+ before I can have my order delivered to me because it comes in a pallet. I have had several heavier items delivered to me in a pallet by other vendors such as my media room furnitures without having to request a separate delivery fee after the fact. This is a very unprofessional behavior and one that I least expected from a Company like this. The fact I actually called them on the phone, gave all the details and they sent me a link to pay for my order online, which i did immediately; only for them to call me a few days after charging my credit card and demanding more money/delivery fee, is what is very worrisome. I would beware of this Company. I have asked that my order be fulfilled as is or canceled and refunded, but they've gone radio silent on me in the last 2-3days as of today Feb 3rd. I am currently exploring my options.

So I have had ok service from Navepoint in the past. Previous purchases online or on location went ok, but it was never a super good experience, so this time I tried to place my order on the phone. When I called they refused to take my order so I asked the sales rep for the part number. After I had the items purchased and paid for online with the part number I was given and had it drop shipped directly to the customer, I then found out their sales rep gave me the wrong part number. When I arrived at my client's to begin the install and seeing the wrong part was shipped I immediately called customer support. I informed Navepoint this piece had to be installed as there was fines if I missed the deadline. Navepoint being in Libertyville and I and my client were in Oak Lawn about 85 min. apart. I informed customer support what happened and they said "I'm sorry but we will send you a tag to return it and when we receive it we will send you a new one. Keep in mind it was $150.00 a day for every day we were late so I said well in that case I will put the rack in with what I have and just bring in the pieces that are wrong next week. Feeling that was fair, again I was told "no sorry the only way to do it was the way previously stated" I then said I could send a courier out with the parts and they would not agree to that either. I then demanded to speak to a sales manager and she told me they could not possibly do that. Getting no where, I then asked for the owner Russ. I had dealt with him over wrong parts they had sent me in the past and according to the sales manager Russ was not in the building, how ever not 45 seconds later he was there letting me know that this was not his fault. Yet I informed him his sales team gave me the wrong number but mistakes happen right. I would never never by any thing from them again. The sales people don't tell the truth, the sales manager lies and they never take responsibility for their mistakes. I have a lot of friends in the IT business and put it on Facebook. I received  25 phone calls from that and more than half of them agreed with what I said. People think if you open a business people will just beat down your door with sales but it is a relationship you build with customers that makes them want to deal with you. I think this is an example of what not to do.I called another vendor they had one delivered to my in 3 hours and they were cheaper than Navepoint. Since then I have spent over $3500.00 in three weeks at the new vendor

Damaged, RTV 1 shelf, will use 2nd shelf.EVERY SINGLE order received since October has had damage, but have used them. An Email response was quick to sending a replacement part, however replacement of part still has not been sent.  Sent an enquiry to support and was told that I would receive an email when the part shipped.  This was on 11/23/21. The first email regarding this issue was on 11/22.  It is now 11/27 and tThis project is now behind schedule.

Review.Contenu: Delivery was fast. I installed the 1 U sever shelf rails. When I went to slid in the Cyberpower rack mount UPS it would only go in half way. I have the identical Navepoint server shelf rails installed above it for my 4U server. It turns out the end of the UPS hits the lip of the bottom piece of the shelf above it. The spacing between the shelfs is off by about 1/8 inch.  Very disappointed. For now I have just lowered the server shelf rails for the UPS by 1U.

I had to band the metal back myself because Customers service never Returned my calls or email for a refund. Your best bet is to order from Amazon it easier to get a refund there.

Review.Titre: The online order was as simple as…
Review.Contenu: The online order was as simple as possible I I do have a big problem with recieving a item iv ordered & it wasn’t professionally packaged I’m sure if you sell items online you have to know about how shipping companies handle products . My item was bent I don’t know if it was already bent or was bent during shipping but it put me in a bad position of buying other products that I have locally vs what I ordered online

Item was received damaged. The back cover was bent the edges, the door edge is dented in right in the middle, etc. It's not enough to warrant the hassle of a return, but this isn't what I paid for either. It was also missing some of the assembly materials. The parts were laid out and counted and I'm missing a nut and a washer, so one of the screws was left out until I can get another one. Again, it's not enough to make it unstable, but enough to not buy from this brand again.

Review.Titre: I ordered a rack with additional…
Review.Contenu: I ordered a rack with additional shelves and panels.The rack was out of stock so they canceled this line item and refunded my CC.  They made no attempt to inform me of this.  I have no rack to install my items. Stuff happens but you got to call me and tell me whats going on. I should not be the person doing the leg work.

Review.Titre: numbering of the punch down block wrong!
Review.Contenu: Good quality product, well made and sturdy. The punch down numbers on the circuit board were not in the correct location. This forced us to ring out all connections and re number the blocks and start over from the beginning. If they included a wire diagram this would have helped but it should be numbered to the standard.

Review.Titre: It came in but I had some small problems.
Review.Contenu: I tried to create an account when I made the order but wasn't able to create a password that it liked. I never got an e-mail with the tracking number. I had to call the customer support for that. The package was supposed to show up 2 days later but turned out to be a week after I ordered it. The rack came in with what looked like half the box being wet and smelled of mildew. The rack was packaged nicely and the rack had no damage (which I have had issues from in the past where components are damaged). All that being said the rack works and it fits my need. I just won't be using Navepoint to fulfill the order anymore.

Review.Titre: Wrong size hardware included? Or bad powder coat job on the screw holes?
Review.Contenu: Shipping mishap aside, when I received the rack it was easy to assemble and mount to the wall. The problems arose when I tried to install devices; patch panels, switches, a shelf, small 1U UPS; the included rack screws didn't fit. I first started routing out screw holes so the screws would fit. Then I tried using smaller rack screws which were tough to get in, but worked.Not exactly a great first impression, especially with a tough time frame to get everything installed, which is why I started off with the "shipping mishap".

I placed order #12969 on 6/29/21 and on the same day, left a message with customer service to cancel it.  No one ever called back on on the next day, the order shipped.  Now I have to pay to have it returned.

Review.Titre: My last navepoint purchase, 15u wall mount cabinet
Review.Contenu: I bought 15u rack from navepoint.  I already had a 12u rack from them that was great.  the 15u rack arrived dented, scratched, the parts were tough to fit together.. the included cage nuts were already stripped (luckily I had more), the locks barely turned because of the rough cuts and condition of the rack I received.I ordered the 12u from amazon as an open box item and it came in better condition that this NEW rack I bought DIRECTLY from navepoint.  Like I said, while I still was able to get the rack together I was disappointed with the quality product I received based upon past experience - I expected more from navepoint in terms of quality.  I'll be switching brands for my next rack purchase

Review.Titre: After I emailed you twice you never…
Review.Contenu: After I emailed you twice you never sent an RMA or called me to return the shelf that did not work with the cabinet I purchased from you as well. Still have not received an RMA.

We received our package in a very timely manner. Opened the package and there were virtually no instructions. A paper with a poor at best drawing... Also the product description does not say that it should be installed on a block or concrete wall. The mounting tabs were not big enough to get more than 2 screws in a stud each side.  And the shelf that is advertised with the bracket is NOT a corner shelf. One would think that with a corner TV bracket it would be a corner shelf. The shelves are not deep enough to hold a DVD player, or most cable/dish boxes. The good part of the shelf was it had EXCELLENT installation instructions. Had I known all of this I don't know that I would have purchased it.

Review.Titre: The rack itself is decent, the customer service not so much
Review.Contenu: The rack itself is decent. However ours was missing over 16bolts to put it together. As well as there were not enough rack screws. We were contacted by Greg Jenson who happens to be the sales guy in our area. He asked if we needed anything. We informed him we had to purchase over $25 worth of bolts because they didn’t send enough. He didn’t take care of us. Just told us that we should contact them next time before we buy. Unfortunately the job we were on timing was crucial as we were wiring a movie theater and waiting for screws when the should have already been sent is unacceptable. We may buy NavePoint again in the future, but as a brand and customer service they definitely didn’t win us over as solid customers going forward. Still in the hunt for that company.

Review.Titre: Good finish -  Bad Tread on front of rack
Review.Contenu: Good finish. Good metal work. No sharp edges.Had to re-tap the 12-24 tread holes in the front of the rack. If you dont have a tap and die set this rack is a problem. It was not a  plug and play experience.

Review.Contenu: don't even know if product is good since I've have not received it as of 10/24/17. Your company may want to get a contract with a better shipping company. They called me 10/19 to inform me they were going to deliver on 10/20 and if we had a loading dock which we do. I told them I won't be in the office on 10/20 and emailed Wills Freight 3 count it 3 contact names with cell phone & lan line numbers. I came back on 10/21 to hear a voicemail message from the shipping company saying they're trying to contact me after all the info I gave them. I left a message for the driver and still haven't heard back. Not good for business. For this reason cheapest isn't always the best route. I work for the State of CA Government and they want us to purchase from the lowest quote not always the best move like in this case. Hope NavePoint uses a better shipping company in the future.

Review.Titre: The assembly instructions are the worst I have ever used.
Review.Contenu: Quality control is obviously not a priority. One of the supports was drilled at an angle resulting in a screw hole aligned to the edge.  THis piece has to be replaced.  Customer service is some what helpful but parts fulfillment is slow.  I like the rack case, but I spent days trying to figure out how to properly mount everything to fit my existing rack rails.  After five attempts I figured out a method that would allow me to close the front door with the back door mounted and using my existing slides.  This configuration unfortunately does not work with the three shelves or the middle support brackets shipped with the cabinet. They are very shallow compared to the depth of the cabinet. Assembly has been a very frustrating and time consuming experience.  This is not my first rack installation, but I hope it is my last. Update:  I did receive my replacement brackets and they sent an extra one for some reason.

We have installed a lot of NavePoint enclosed racks with the glass doors. They are built strong and have a professional look to them. The price point is pretty good compared to similar racks we've used in the past. To improve we continually have 2 problems. The shipping almost always has boxes ripped due to weight and sometimes hardware is falling out and scratches on corners (Reinforce packaging). During operation on site the built in fans generate lots of complaints as they get very loud. Most times we have customers unplug them as they sound horrendous. If you punch rack a couple of times it will get quiet again (Better fans and secure them better to rack).

Pros: Product was well packaged, reasonable in price, shipping was quick. Customer service was courteous, empathetic, and helpful. Cons:Poor documentation; the build instructions were not as clear as they should be but were workable. Was missing a step about grounding wire. The datasheet was inaccurate, listing a 130 pounds weight limit that applies only when floor mounted or on casters. Wall weight limit is only 50lbs and this was only found out after attempting to load equipment, the rack sagging significantly,then contacting support.

The product ordered was slight damaged during shipping.  The server drawer attachment tabs were slightly bent upon arrival some of the paint on the tabs was sratched as well.   I suspect the damage was caused during shipping but better packaging around the corners and attachment tabs of the drawer could have prevented this.  The damage is easily fixable and I will not be returning.   Aside from this damage caused during shipping the drawer is very high quality and better than I had expected.

5 stars for the products.1 star for customer care.I like their products, I kept buying, and I'll keep buying.I hope I'll not need to talk to them because they do not care. I do not expect at this point any support/answer in the future.Quite happy with the products and with delivery experience, everything is great.

Review.Titre: Good products, but Shipping details need to be more revealing and prominent
Review.Contenu: Navepoint's products are as advertised and well made.  However, if you are needing something shipped expeditiously, please read all of the fine print regarding 1 day, 2 day shipping before purchasing because 2 day shipping, could in fact turn out to be more like 5 days depending on the time of the day you place an order, the fact that weekend days do not count as shipping days, and if there is a holiday on a Monday or a Friday that does not count either, so buyer beware because you may end up shelling out hundreds of dollars to get a product shipped quickly, only to find out you won't get it when you expect.  This opinion sounds like personal experience, and it is.  I will hand it to Navepoint in that they refunded part of my shipping cost when this scenario unfolded for me after a bit of arm twisting.  I would like to see the shipping details more prominently displayed especially when 1 or 2 day shipping is being selected.  I understand we are all responsible for ourselves, but the buying experience here with regard to shipping can be improved in my view.

Review.Titre: Everything was good it would help when…
Review.Contenu: Everything was good it would help when you pick a product you could have the choice to easily see what works with the product chosen.  i.e. shelving, power mgmt etc.

Review.Titre: Called for info was told someone would…
Review.Contenu: Called for info was told someone would email or call back neither happen

Review.Titre: The overall structure was very weak
Review.Contenu: The overall structure was very weak. It was not as sturdy as I thought it would be.

This is the second rack drawer I've gotten from these people. The first one has a very slightly bent side on the front of the drawer which prevents it from closing all the way. This new one the drawer doesn't even seat properly and close all the way. They look like factory B stock but there is no mention of that on the site when you buy it. Not sure I'd order from these folks again. They do ship very quickly.

Review.Titre: The rack I ordered was a great deal and…
Review.Contenu: The rack I ordered was a great deal and a nice addition to my studio.  Unfortunately, it was missing some hardware that was instrumental to the assembly. I reached out to customer service and we exchanged a couple of emails regarding the issue.  I provided pictures and descriptions of what I needed. I never got a follow-up or indication that they were going to send me the missing items. After a couple of weeks, I went to the hardware store and Amazon to order the parts I needed. In summary, great products, but lacking customer service.

Review.Titre: Every single order has had damage
Review.Contenu: Every single order has had damage, mostly minor abrasions in the same spots, apparently caused by mishandling or insufficient packaging at the manufacturing source. However, the last order (early NOV 2021 had severe damage of the the cabinet top and it was reported to NavePoint. Photos were sent to Navepoint Customer Service.Other than that, orders are usually confirmed and shipped in a timely manner and we're pleased that shipments are made using FedEx. Our order from 11/10, however is late and not yet received as of 11/15/21..

Shipping, Service are great. Most products are well priced and of decent quality.I have had multiple problems with the 00406362 50 pack of cat6 keystone data jacks. In each 50 pack I have had an 8 to 10 percent failure rate. It is not worth sending a tech back to replace the defective jack. I have had this discussion with Navepoint in the past with other orders.I

Review.Titre: The products are great, but the service was disappointing.
Review.Contenu: The products are great, but the service was not so good.  There was no indication that the vertical cable manager could not be mounted to the 4 post rack (purchased on the same order).  I asked for help using the messaging system, but it took more than 2 weeks to get a response.  That response (which included my order number) just asked for the sku number for the two parts.I ended up drilling new holes in the vertical cable manager so it could be mounted on the rack.  I still haven't heard back from the on-site messenger.

I used to order from NavePoint and would get the order in a day or two at the most.  My last few orders have shipped out of California so it takes a full week to get the order.  I'm on the East Coast.  I'm not sure why this changed, but it is worth noting to plan ahead timewise.

Review.Titre: Good rack. Had door fitment issues.
Review.Contenu: The rack is what I wanted and needed for a project we did for a client. Bought based on the recommendation by a friend that uses these a lot. The door didn’t close properly. Required time to bend metal so it would. Not sure if it’s a packing issue and happened in shipping or just not made well. Other than the door the rack is nice.

Product was shipped flat packed which is expected and acceptable.  However, either due to the flat pack of the product or the manufacuting of it some of the edges were bent.  I bent back, as best I could, the edges into not quite a straight line. This made fitting the pieces together difficult and some of pieces fit either a little snug or loose.  The product over all is good and I would buy it again, but the bent pieces show either a lack of care in packaging and shipping or in manufacturing.

Review.Titre: Some good and some bad feedback
Review.Contenu: Some good and some bad feedbackNavepoint 12U 450mm Depth Network Cabinet Consumer SeriesGood- The order arrived on time as expected.- The price was good for the network cabinet size and features. Bad- The instructions to assemble the network cabinet are terrible and very difficult to follow.- The network cabinet had some bent edges that had to be adjusted to assemble the cabinet.

Assembly was a process... had to take apart and try a second time. Slight bends in top and bottom made problems with hole alignment and rail mounting. In the end, 11:30 pm, the finished product was exactly what I expected when I ordered it on-line, a very functional 9U Consumer Series Data Cabinet. For the price worth every penny... just not the long assembly process.

I bought a "consumer grade" equipment rack to house my NAS, Modem, Router, ARLO Camera Base Stations and a few other items. My issue is there is no accommodation for access for a power lead to the Power Strip I mounted, nor any designed access for the Modem Cable. I was able to "jury rig" access through one of the wall mounting holes for the Modem cable, and one of the Latch accesses on the side panel for the power cord. I did not "wall mount" the device, it is free standing. A designated , designed access port at the top and bottom of each side panel would be very helpful.

Build Quality: Our technical folks have been coming back with complaints concerning the build quality.  Mainly how much labor it takes to put together many of the wall racks, as well as the durability of the materials used.  They have said if they come mostly put together, and are made of slightly thicker metal would be a real benefit.

Review.Titre: Caution. Before assembly make sure there are no dents on the rack!!
Review.Contenu: I was looking for a server wall mount rack and couldn’t decide on a brand...After a lot of research I decided to go with NavePoint and ordered the Glassdoor 12U pro series. When my item arrived I immediately opened the box and started the assembly process and found a big dent on the metal holding the glass door... I literally paid extra because the glass door makes the rack looks more professional...I thought about calling and request a refund but at that time I had assembled 90% of the rack. Now I’m stuck with a big dent on the front of my rack.

The online ordering process was good, and I did receive the product.  However, I was not able to check my order online for 2 days, nor received any emails about my order (received, processing or shipped).  When calling for a status of the order the rep could not look it up and stated he would check and call me back.  I never received a callback.  Not a good start to a relationship with a new enterprise customer.  I would expect thorough communications (verbal or email) with a representative about my orders.

Review.Titre: I returned a vented shelf as per…
Review.Contenu: I returned a vented shelf as per directions from a person in customer service.  I was seeking a refund since it didn't fit my Navepoint Rack.  I waited literally weeks even sending a message via the issue portal and NOTHING.  I finally had enough so I was on the chat and the person told me to follow the same procedure.  I told them I had and yet NO response and NOW what is the next step to resolution.  A Customer Service called me and processed the return they had received weeks previously.  The Rep apologized for the delay and said they were the ONLY person in that role.  She needs help from management to get more resource working the CS Desk.

The product is awesome and very sturdy. The price is perfect and can be used for different servers without the need for additional parts or modifications. The only issue is that the shipping by Fedex ground took longer than it should and showed on the Fedex website without any explanation as to why or correct and accurate tracking information for the customer

Included instructions define tilt as 15 degrees while on line literature states 20 degrees.There's no "stop to keep the TV fro sliding off either end of the mount. The arms are not interchangeable and that's not explained in the directions.The directions are very sketchy, should be much more specific and detailed.

Review.Titre: Partly really good and partly really aweful
Review.Contenu: For the ability to buy on line and updates to the order status I would give you 5. For the lack of basic telephone queuing set up and reply to my follow up email I give you 1-I still have not had a reply from the middle of last week

Review.Titre: Arrived quickly but had multiple dented…
Review.Contenu: Arrived quickly but had multiple dented parts.  It was fairly simple to put together alone but took extra time to try and adjust it so that the door was properly aligned. For the price, I expected better.

Your rack shelves are excellent. However your blank rack panels are oversized and not in compliance with standardized dimensions. On the 1RU vented and non vented panels the size is approximately 1/32" over height. If I try stacking multiple panels after stacking about 6RU the screws won't align with the rack threads.  I don't know if mechanically you allowed for the thickness of the powered coating. Your 1, 2 and 4RU models all exhibit this issue.  Good quality panels with a great finish but not dimensionally correct.

Everything was fine when placing the order. NavePoint shipped it right away. I give them three stars because they shipped with FedEx. My network rack has been sitting at the local fedex warehouse for 7 days now. 7! FedEx has come up with every excuse in the book not to even attempt a delivery . I can’t even go there and get it because it is the type that has no shipping center or customer support. All I can do is request it be held at a different facility. I was given three choices all of them at a Walmart. Now I have to wait for them to deliver it there just so I can go pick it up. Will likely be 10 days total, this doesn’t include the actual transit time. Please stop shipping with FedEx.

This the second shipment that I have received from NavePoint that has had internal damaged to  the components. They quickly took care of the first one in 2018 and I have just sent them a E-Mail about a recent shipment. The shipping box had no visible signs of damage by the shipper.

I enjoy Navepoint products. However, living in a big city like N.Y.. getting large items shipped to my home with FedEx is aggravating. It's unfortunate for Navepoint to suffer due to fedex shipment practices. So, I will most likely stop buying Navepoint altogether. Not worth the trouble!

Acceptable quality, terrible instructions.I like the case but the actual rail supports are flimsy. I had to reassemble the entire case as the printed instructions were extremely blurry. Case is great, but 2 stars off for both the instructions and the flimsy rack points.

Over the last year or so I've placed a couple orders for NavePoint rack shelves.  Each time, the experience was the same.  Some of the shelves are fine, while others arrived bent or with chips in the paint.  I was able to bend the shelves back into shape, so I kept them.  Not sure if it's shipping damage, or if they came that way from the factory.I also have one of their 4 post racks, that I'm quite happy with.  Their pricing is also very competitive.I've never been able to use the PayPal feature on their site, they need to fix it.

Love the company and products...your website is terrible.  Selecting the coupon offer disables ability to log into my account.  Clearing cookies and log in worked, but when purchase items are selected, they disappear when I try to checkout....ugh!Get a more focused IT guy.

Review.Titre: The product is great but could be…
Review.Contenu: The product is great but could be better is how they are packed and shipped. The rack ears have come bent on the shelves I have ordered. With some effort they can be bent back into shape but there should be a way that in shipping the ears don't get bent. Thank you.

Not enough bolts, washers and screws for equipmentFlimsy rack railsSquare holed racks harder to mount equipment.  Pre tapped rack rails are much better, and save a step for mounting equipment.Very difficult and time consuming build

The rack is good, but the shelf send with wrong screw for my rack. Call customer service then make me to pay for the screw. After complaints then said will ship to my with in 48 hours. But never see the screws almost a week.

Great experience, but why?  Why does the 1U drawer (00401459) only opens 7.5"?  I cannot even reach my hand in far enough to hit the back wall.  Small parts like headphone adapters roll to the back and you need a tool to extract them.  In today's age all quality drawers should have full extension, especially on a drawer this shallow.  Nice product, but I'll be looking to replace the drawer slides.Edit:  4 Stars to 3 Stars - I wondered why NavePoint is selling the same product listed in multiple categories with different pricing.  After posting my review I see others have confirmed this unethical pricing.

Review.Titre: Well..you get what you pay for
Review.Contenu: Well..you get what you pay for. I went for the consumer series 9u enclosure. Right out the box, I had to grab a pair of pliers and straighten out some pieces that were bent. Not good. The included instructions were horrible. I feel sorry for anyone that has never built one of these enclosures. They will have a hard time for sure. I´ve built several of these over the last couple of years and have learned to just go to the website and download the instructions they have there. Once assembled, the enclosure is pretty decent. Next time I have to purchase another enclosure, i´ll go for the Pro series. Seems to be better built and sturdier.

So the wire seems quality, much larger than I anticipated,  more like 14 ga. Instead of 18ga. Made it difficult to use as intended, but with splicing 20 ga. On hand, made it work. Just never seen an 18ga. 4c so large

Review.Titre: Pricing has gone up and you STILL dont…
Review.Contenu: Pricing has gone up and you STILL dont have a place for us to enter a PO# on orders....Makes tracking in our warehouse very very difficult.  I've been told several times to stop buying from you.

Review.Titre: The Monitor stand is nice, but it's not quite what i expected.
Review.Contenu: I ordered a 3 Monitor stand for up to 27" screens, however not all three 27" screens fit without overlapping the others... I'm a bit disappointed by the fact that I didn't quite get what I had hoped...

Review.Titre: Good quality products, not so well protected inside the box
Review.Contenu: The quality of the products is good. Unfortunately, the items were not well protected inside the box, one 1u vented cantilever shelf and one 1u horizontal rack mount cable management metal raceway unit came came bent.
Sturdy, well crafted, excellent sliding mechanism. However one major negative. Most of the holes did not line up with my rack rails. I managed to make both drawers work but it took some effort.

Review.Titre: Great selection, good products, need help with packing.
Review.Contenu: NavePoint's selection is great, and their prices are very reasonable.  Unfortunately, one of the items I ordered -- a rack shelf -- was damaged in shipping: one of the 'ears' was bent badly, and unusable as received.  These things happen, but in my opinion the shipping box was insufficiently packed with filler to keep the items in place during shipping.  I was able to bend the shelf back to useful shape, but of course, some of the paint chipped off and had to be touched up.To NavePoint's credit, they quickly offered to either a) replace the item, or b) give me a discount for the damage.  Because I could not wait for a replacement in this situation, I took the discount.I would be inclined to give them another try at a later time.

Review.Titre: My rack shelf and (missing!) 50 pack of …
Review.Contenu: My rack shelf and (missing!) 50 pack of cage nuts and screws arrived in a large box that was taped ONLY at the center seam, and not very well, at that. I'm 99% sure the hardware pack slipped out of the box, due to the LARGE GAP that was evident when you flexed the box. When I called CS to report the shortage, they were largely incredulous that the 50 pack of hardware was not in the box, even insisting that I "look carefully" in the box once more to make sure they weren't really there. I did not appreciate their disbelief or condescension. They DID ship a replacement bag of hardware, but the experience really made me question their commitment to customer service. How can they NOT KNOW HOW TO PROPERLY TAPE A BOX???
Slow shipping. Order has not arrived after 8 days…Small Order,Still waiting, payed extra for shipping ……14/2 White speaker wire, unable to finish surround install.
navepoint always makes good products. However the price increases were way too much. Now the price points is much higher than other similar products.

Review.Titre: Great quality product. Order and shipment info needs improvement.
Review.Contenu: Didn’t receive an order or shipment notification, so had to contact support. Support was helpful. Great product once received! Quality of product surpassed my already high expectations.

Review.Titre: Great shelves - horrible experience with website
Review.Contenu: The shelves I purchased from NavePoint are great.  My issue is with their website.  After I selected the shelves, I elected to pay using PayPal, but the site would not ever let me complete the transaction.  I totally closed out my browser and tried a different browser after getting some online "help", all with no success.  I then backed out and tried to pay with my credit card I couldn't even get to enter the card number..  I finally tried using Amazon Pay and that finally worked.  I can't begin to describe the frustration I felt before finally getting their site to complete the transaction.  After that, however, the shipment was scheduled for delivery the next Wednesday, but he they showed up on the Friday before - SUPER fast.  And again, the shelves themselves are great.

Review.Titre: I ordered from your company and paid an…
Review.Contenu: I ordered from your company and paid an enormous amount for overnight and the product didn't arrive until that following Tuesday. This is just unacceptable!
Living in a rural location I was disappointed to find my package dropped off next to my distant mailbox next to a busy rural road instead of being left by my house.
On arrival, the box was falling apart. The spindle was damaged with splinters protruding. It doesn't roll anymore. The cable itself is undamaged at the very least.
No product accessory matching. Shelving does not fit all cabinets, so each shelf or cabinet should include compatibility matrix so products aren’t ordered incorrectly.

Review.Titre: The front door sags requiring you to…
Review.Contenu: The front door sags requiring you to "lift and push" to properly close and lock it.  The assembly was straight forward and the directions were fine.
Good sturdy frame. Powder coating quality is good.  Would give 5 stars if there would have been enough fasteners to mount all of the components.

Review.Contenu: My issues are not your fault.But, Fed Ex SUCKS!!  I am still waiting for a rack that should have been here 3 days ago.

Review.Titre: I hesitated to purchase my NavePoint…
Review.Contenu: I hesitated to purchase my NavePoint 22U enclosed rack based on some harsh reviews I read online. Packing arrived damaged, metal is bent or will not align, and poor set up instructions were the most troubling. The alternative was something double, or more, in price with not great reviews. I ordered the product. All of the issues in the reviews are accurate. The package was damaged, but not terribly. The parts inside were protected well, so I don't think they were damaged in transit. The instructions were for a much smaller unit and did not have instructions for all of the parts included on my unit. It wasn't enough of a problem to keep me from getting it assembled. There were bent and scratched parts and the door will not stay closed without being latched. All of these issues are preventable with a little more quality control before shipping. One design feature change I would like to see is a removable back panel similar to the side panels. Overall, the online reviews are correct, but not necessarily bad enough to make it a bad purchase. If you can work with the issues, buy it. If you want perfection pass.
Good product and delivery. No directions and screws sent were useless without cage nuts needed to secure shelves.
My order never arrived. However, customer service was fairly prompt and offered me a full refund.

Review.Contenu: The cabinet is okay but it could be made stronger with thicker walls and better locks.

Review.Contenu: Product good, shipping horrible

Review.Titre: Site states free shipping - but be advised
Review.Contenu: Update: 7/18/2018I have yet to receive a follow up from Navepoint as to why my package was shipped via Fedex home service - when being delivered to a work (non residential) address. Their customer service rep said she would get back to me and has yet to do so as of this update. Update: 6/28/2018I was contacted my NavePoint Customer Service. They expressed  that they intend to investigate this matter. I still don't have an answer as to why my parcel was sent using FedEx Ground to Home service - which effectively took my parcel hostage from me. I remain hesitant to order any new racks from the NavePoint site until I know what happened to my parcel and what their new shipping process and timeline is to resolve this matter moving forward. NavePoint is going to send me some additional rack screws (thanks NavePoint - I do appreciate that). In response to my question as to why they don't provide that many screws. 1. The rack I ordered was a starter kit and comes with minimal screws. To that I said, the rack should include enough screws to accommodate mounting 6 (six) 1U items. The CS rep said she will pass that comment onto the product team. 2. They assume that network equipment providers provide their own mounting screws in the box with their equipment. I advised the CS rep that there are at least 2 different U.S. and 2 different Metric thread size standards. Assuming that the mounting screws provided by the network equipment manufacturer will fit the NavePoint rack is an incorrect assumption. The CS rep said she will pass that comment onto the product team.  I will provide updates to this review as they become available. I am updating the rating based on their effort to call me and express interest in correcting the matter. +++++++Original ReviewSite states free shipping - however - doesn't declare the shipping method used. In my case, Navepoint chose to use FedEx ground to home delivery - which only delivers Tuesday through Saturday. My parcel was scheduled for delivery on Saturday to my company, which is closed on Saturday. When I contacted FedEx to have the package re-routed, I was told there was nothing they could do (I could not have the package routed to a FedEx facility, FedEx retail location, scheduled for a Monday pickup at a FedEx location). It was hostage to FedEx.  To make matters worse, they said it would not be delivered on Monday either - as the "shipper" used a home delivery (Tuesday through Saturday) shipping method. I ordered this with plenty of time to be delivered to the SF bay area without falling into the day of the week trap. I needed this rack for a network install. I'm disappointed with both Navepoint and FedEx for having put me into this experience. One small win however. The parcel was unexpectedly delivered to me on Monday (even though FedEx emphatically told me it wasn't going to be delivered to me). This enabled me to complete my network install the following Tuesday AM. I would have to think long and hard before I order anything from Navepoint again. There are other options.- I may consider paying extra for proper shipping on/from Navepoint site- I can purchase the item(s) through Amazon (which costs more, but comes with Prime shipping. - Alternatively, I can order products from either Monoprice or PI Manufacturing - both of which have reliable shipping processes.   The FedEx home delivery shipping method is the worst - ever. They just don't care.Other items of noticeable concern. Navepoint only provides like12 screws for their 6U rack. That's only enough to mount 3 (three) 1U items. How about a few more screws folks, they're like .002 cents each. I have come across machining issues with the threads on some of their racks. I've mentioned this to them before. Never heard anything back. Nothing like being out in the field only to find that some of the screw-holes are not properly threaded.I'm giving this review 2-stars as I realize the issues with FedEx are not entirely Navepoints problem.

Door and cabinet damage, definitely left factory like this, not do to shipper, box was undamaged, hopefully they will make it right and I will rewrite my experience! I understand sometimes things happen. Hopefully they will make it right.! After emailing and speaking with someone live from NavePoint , they did resolve some of my issues and sent me new parts and my complaints were handled, reasonably and quickly!
I found the site very easy to navigate, and the pictures/descriptions of the items helped me shop confidently. Keep adding more products to your line; I will return to your site to shop again.

Person/Representative actually answered the phone versus a recording instructing to leave a message. Representative responded to questions happily and professionally. Would have given 4.5 stars; rarely give 5 stars. First time working with NavePoint.

Shipping was very prompt and we feel the cost of the unit was fair. We have not installed the case (was purchased for a clients installation), but we assume it will be simple- if not we will contact support.

Review.Titre: A very nice well built rack
Review.Contenu: A very nice well built rack  , but when buying shelves it does not state which selves will work with what rack , found it hard to get ahold of anyone to answer that question.
I don't give anyone 5 stars.  That said, I'll definitely order from this company again when the need arises. Fast, fast, fast shipping.  That was most excellent.

Review.Contenu: we really like your products and have made it a standard part of our solutions. The ordering process is easy and availability is great. The only challenge i have is the margins we have the ability to make without exceeding published price.

Review.Contenu: The product arrived quickly and was easy to install.  The only reason I have a 4 rather than a 5 is that it doesn't allow for enough room under monitors, even when you place the monitors at the highest point.
